Package search

Class Problem

java.lang.Object
search.Problem
Direct Known Subclasses:
EightPuzzleProblem, SubwayProblem
public abstract class Problem
extends java.lang.Object

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Problem​(State initial)
    The constructor specifies the initial state.
    Problem​(State initial, State goal)
    The constructor specifies the initial state and a unique goal state.

    • Problem

      public Problem​(State initial)
      The constructor specifies the initial state. Your subclass's constructor can add other arguments.
      Parameters:
      initial - The initial state of the problem

    • Problem

      public Problem​(State initial, State goal)
      The constructor specifies the initial state and a unique goal state. Your subclass's constructor can add other arguments.
      Parameters:
      initial - The initial state of the problem
      goal - The goal state of the problem

  • Method Details

    • getInitial

      public State getInitial()
      Return the initial state
      Returns:
      The problem's initial state

    • successor

      public abstract java.util.ArrayList<Tuple> successor​(State state)
      Given a state, return a set of (action, state) pairs reachable from this state.
      Parameters:
      state - A problem state
      Returns:
      A list of all (Action, State) pairs (as Tuples) that are reachable from the given state.

    • goalTest

      public boolean goalTest​(State state)
      Returns true if the given state is a goal. The default method compares the state to this.goal, as specified in the constructor. Override this method if checking against a single goal is not enough.
      Parameters:
      state - A problem state
      Returns:
      True if the given state is a goal, false otherwise.

    • pathCost

      public double pathCost​(double c, State state1, Action action, State state2)
      Return the cost of a solution path that arrives at state2 from state1 via action, assuming cost c to get up to state1. If the problem is such that the path doesn't matter, this function will only look at state2. If the path does matter, it will consider c and maybe state1 and action. The default method costs 1 for every step in the path.
      Parameters:
      c - The path cost so far up to state1
      state1 - The state prior to an action
      action - The action taken
      state2 - The state after taking the action
      Returns:
      The total path cost up to state2

    • h

      public double h​(Node node)
      Return the heuristic function value for a particular node. By default, returns 0. Override this if using informed (heuristic) search.
      Parameters:
      node - A search node
      Returns:
      The heuristic value for the state in that search node.
